skill.name: ntm
skill.description: Named Tmux Manager - Multi-agent orchestration for Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini in tiled tmux panes. Visual dashboards, command palette, context rotation, robot mode API, work assignment, safety system. Go CLI.
skill.summary: Named Tmux Manager - Multi-agent orchestration for Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini in tiled tmux pane...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: NTM is a powerful multi-agent orchestration tool with significant security risks. It executes AI agents with dangerous permission bypasses, uses insecure installation methods, and has extensive system access capabilities. While potentially useful for legitimate purposes, the tool's design enables supply chain attacks and arbitrary code execution.

critical_findings.title: Insecure Installation Method
critical_findings.description: Recommends piping curl output directly to bash: 'curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Dicklesworthstone/ntm/main/install.sh | bash'. This is a classic supply chain attack vector that allows arbitrary code execution without verification.

critical_findings.title: Dangerous Agent Execution Flags
critical_findings.description: Configures AI agents with security bypasses: 'claude --dangerously-skip-permissions', 'codex --dangerously-bypass-approvals-and-sandbox', 'gemini --yolo'. These flags explicitly disable safety mechanisms designed to protect users.

high_findings.title: Arbitrary Command Execution via Hooks
high_findings.description: Command hooks system allows arbitrary command execution on events like 'post-spawn', 'pre-send', etc. Example: 'command = "notify-send \'NTM\' \'Agents spawned\'"'. Could be exploited to run malicious commands.

high_findings.title: External Webhook Data Transmission
high_findings.description: Supports sending data to external webhooks: 'url = "https://hooks.slack.com/..."'. Could be used to exfiltrate sensitive session data or agent outputs to unauthorized endpoints.

medium_findings.title: Broad Filesystem Access
medium_findings.description: Tool accesses user projects and can read/write files system-wide. Projects base directory configurable via NTM_PROJECTS_BASE. No apparent restrictions on file access scope.

medium_findings.title: Environment Variable Access
medium_findings.description: Reads multiple environment variables for configuration including NTM_PROJECTS_BASE, NTM_THEME, NTM_ICONS, NTM_REDUCE_MOTION, NTM_PROFILE. Could potentially access sensitive environment data.

dangerous_patterns.title: Multi-Agent Command Distribution
dangerous_patterns.description: Sends commands to multiple AI agents simultaneously: 'ntm send myproject --all "implement a rate limiter"'. Could amplify malicious commands across multiple agents.

dangerous_patterns.title: Session Persistence Across SSH
dangerous_patterns.description: Sessions persist across SSH disconnections, which could leave active agents running unattended with potentially sensitive context.

content.user_title: Orchestrate Multiple AI Agents in Tmux Sessions
content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI coding agents creates window chaos and breaks workflow. NTM solves this by orchestrating Claude, Codex, and Gemini agents in unified tmux sessions with visual dashboards.
actual_capabilities: Spawn and manage multiple AI agents in tmux panes
Send commands to specific agent types or all agents
Visual dashboard with agent status and metrics
Command palette with fuzzy search for prompts
Context window rotation to prevent overflow
Robot mode API for machine-readable output
limitations: Command execution capabilities pose security risks
No built-in authentication for multi-user scenarios
Agent outputs may contain sensitive information

use_cases.title: Multi-Agent Code Review
use_cases.description: Send code to Claude for analysis, Codex for implementation, and Gemini for testing in parallel

use_cases.title: Infrastructure Automation
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple AI agents to design, implement, and document infrastructure changes

use_cases.title: Agent Comparison Studies
use_cases.description: Run identical prompts across different AI models to compare outputs and approaches

prompt_templates.title: Basic Multi-Agent Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new project with AI assistance
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a tmux session with 2 Claude agents for architecture and 1 Codex agent for implementation

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Send my authentication module to all agents and ask for security review

prompt_templates.title: Divide and Conquer
prompt_templates.prompt: Have Claude design the API, Codex implement it, and Gemini write tests

prompt_templates.title: Competitive Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask all agents to implement a rate limiter and compare their solutions

best_practices: Always review agent outputs before implementing suggestions
Use context rotation to prevent token overflow
Set up safety system to block dangerous commands
anti_patterns: Sending sensitive credentials to AI agents
Running with dangerous permission bypass flags

faq.question: Is NTM compatible with all tmux versions?
faq.answer: NTM requires tmux 3.0 or higher for full functionality

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Go 1.19+, tmux 3.0+, and terminal with 256-color support

faq.question: Can I integrate NTM with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, NTM provides shell integration and command hooks for customization

faq.question: How does NTM handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: NTM has a safety system, but agents may still access sensitive files

faq.question: What if an agent gets stuck or errors?
faq.answer: Use 'ntm interrupt' to stop all agents or restart individual panes

faq.question: How is NTM different from running agents manually?
faq.answer: NTM provides orchestration, persistence, and unified management across agents
